title: Create OO integration admin user in the Service Management IdM (GKE)
content:
Create the OO integration admin user 

The OO integration admin user is responsible for performing integration between OO and IdM. OO uses the credentials of the user to synchronize groups and roles from IdM to OO.

Currently, OO is tightly integrated with SM IdM, and a standalone IdM for OO is not supported.

You can create the OO integration admin user in the IdM portal by following the instructions below.

  1. Log in to the Service Management IdM (https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin) with suite-admin account, and then click on SYSBO IdM organization.

  2. Go to Users in the navigation pane, and click   on the toolbar. The ADD USER page opens.

  3. Create the OO integration admin user using the following values and then click SAVE.

    Field (*required) Description
    Name* Name of the new user. To avoid confusion later, enter the user name as oo-integration-admin. 
    Display Name* Display name of the new user. Use oo-integration-admin in this case.
    Password* Specify a password for the OO integration admin user.
    Type* Select SYSTEM.
    Password Policy Leave the field empty.
    User Attributes Leave empty.
  4. Click SAVE.
    When selecting type SYSTEM, if a user doesn't have a password policy, a "defaultFor=SYSTEM" password policy gets assigned to the user when you click SAVE. 

Associate oo-integration-admin to the administrators group

  1. In the suite IdM (https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin), access the SYSBO organization.
  2. Go to Groups in the navigation pane, click the administrators group, and then click   on the toolbar. The Group Settings page opens.
  3. Scroll down to the Users section, in the Associated Users field, search for and click the oo-integration-admin user to associate it to the group. 
  4. Click SAVE.
